stories.text: Our class is having an election for class president. This is an example of **democracy**, where we all get to vote. We are starting a **campaign** to tell everyone our ideas. Before the election, our teacher **appointed** Mia as the temporary leader. It's a big job. She has to help when things get **chaotic**, like when everyone is talking at once. Her main rule is to **confine** all running and shouting to the playground, not the classroom.

Hi Team,

I know this first week at the new office was incredibly **chaotic**! Papers were everywhere, and the phones never stopped ringing. The company is in the middle of a huge new advertising **campaign**, so everyone is busy.

I was **appointed** as the junior coordinator, which means I help organize you all. For now, please try to **confine** your questions to email so I can keep track. I promise this company is a great place to work; it has a strong feeling of **democracy**, and the boss actually listens to everyone's opinion.

Best,
Alex

The transition from a monarchy to a full **democracy** was not a smooth process for the nation. After the revolution, the new government **appointed** a special committee to write a constitution. However, their first goal was to **confine** the powers of the new leader, to ensure no single person could become a tyrant. The situation in the capital remained **chaotic** for months, with different groups fighting for control. To win public support, the interim leaders launched a massive information **campaign** to explain the benefits of the new system.

The mayor's latest urban renewal project has been criticized as being more of a publicity **campaign** than a genuine effort to help citizens. Critics argue that the project seems designed to **confine** the city's poorest residents to specific zones, rather than integrating them. The problems worsened when the mayor **appointed** a personal friend, who lacks experience, to oversee the budget. This has led to a **chaotic** allocation of resources, and the entire action fundamentally undermines the principles of social **democracy** that he claims to support.

Hey, are you okay? You seem **alienated** from everyone at lunch. You sat all alone. I have a strange **conception** of what might be wrongâ€”did you have a fight with Sam? I know he can be **combative** and likes to argue. He **demanded** that I choose a side, which isn't fair. How about we get a **combination** of snacks after school and talk?

My original **conception** of this recipe was that it would be very simple. I was wrong! This dish **demanded** much more attention than I expected. The flavor is a perfect **combination** of sweet and spicy. Be careful with the ginger, though. If you add too much, the taste becomes very strong and **combative**, almost fighting with the other spices. I don't want you to feel **alienated** from cooking, so I promise my next recipe will be much easier!

Our initial **conception** of the project was too ambitious. The client **demanded** a final product by next week, which was unrealistic. This impossible deadline created a tense, **combative** atmosphere in the office, with teams blaming each other. As a result, the design team felt completely **alienated** from the process and stopped sharing their ideas. The only path forward is a **combination** of a new timeline and better communication.

The protagonist's deeply **alienated** state is the engine of the novel. His entire **conception** of the world is shaped by his isolation. This alienation isn't passive; it's a **combative** stance against a society he feels has rejected him. The author skillfully **demanded** that the reader sit with this discomfort, offering no easy answers. The character is a complex **combination** of vulnerability and aggression, making him one of the most compelling figures in modern fiction.

Welcome to the School Pet Club! This is a friendly **association** for all animal lovers. We have a student **committee** that plans fun events. I want to **assure** you that all our pets are friendly. Sometimes our meetings get a little loud, but it's never total **chaos**. Our only rule is that we do not discuss **controversial** topics, like which pet is "better." We are all friends here.

The city is in complete **chaos** following the mayor's speech. The new policy is extremely **controversial**, and many people are angry. The mayor formed a special **committee** to review the policy, but citizens are not satisfied. A spokesperson tried to **assure** the public that their voices were being heard. However, the local citizens' **association** has already planned a large protest for this weekend.

To: All Staff
Re: New Partnership

I want to **assure** everyone that the new partnership with TechCorp will be good for us. I know the decision was **controversial**, but the executive **committee** voted unanimously in favor. This **association** will open up new markets for us. I understand there is some fear about job changes, which can create a feeling of **chaos**, but we have a clear plan for a smooth transition.

The historical **committee** reviewing the artifacts made a highly **controversial** decision to re-date the items. This decision has thrown the entire timeline of the period into **chaos**, effectively rewriting history. The evidence relies on a tenuous **association** between two previously unconnected sites. While the authors **assure** their readers that their methodology is sound, the academic community remains deeply divided over these radical claims.

When Dr. Elias Vance was **appointed** to the governing board of the Historical Integrity **Association**, he believed it to be the pinnacle of his career. This esteemed **committee**, a self-proclaimed bastion of academic **democracy**, was tasked with preserving the nationâ€™s founding narratives.

However, Vanceâ€™s initial **conception** of the group as a body of objective scholars quickly dissolved. He found their work to be a strange **combination** of rigorous research and willful blindness to inconvenient truths. His attempts to introduce new, albeit **controversial**, evidence were met with a frosty, unwelcoming silence.

His nature was not passive; it was intellectually **combative**. He couldn't just sit by. He openly **demanded** a review of the societyâ€™s most cherished publications, labeling them as flawed. This, of course, did not endear him to the old guard. He soon found himself completely **alienated** from the inner circle, his memos unanswered.

In response, Vance initiated what could only be described as an internal **campaign** for reform. He bypassed the leadership and presented his findings directly to the junior members. The result was predictable: utter **chaos**. The organization, once a place of quiet consensus, became a battlefield of academic warfare.

The established members tried to **confine** the damage, limiting his access to archives and restricting his speaking time at symposia. The situation became so **chaotic** that the chairwoman had to intervene. She tried to **assure** the members that proper procedure would be followed, but the trust within the institution was already broken.

association.definition: Being together or connected with another person as a friend or partner.
association.example: Cathy feels greatly depressed because her parents are opposed to her association with the boy she loves.

alienated.definition: Feeling like you are not part of a group or family; feeling alone.
alienated.example: Parents often feel alienated from their children. There is often a generation gap between parents and children.

appointed.definition: To choose someone for a job or an important position.
appointed.example: Several years later, she was appointed sales manager.

campaign.definition: A plan with many steps to help someone win an election or sell a product.
campaign.example: Florida was a key state in his campaign for re-election.

chaotic.definition: Very messy and not in order; full of confusion.
chaotic.example: The traffic in Taipei was really chaotic before the completion of the MRT.

committee.definition: A group of people from a bigger group who meet to make decisions.
committee.example: The committee consists of twelve members.

combination.definition: Two or more different things that are put or mixed together.
combination.example: It's hard to describe such a feeling. Maybe we can say that it's a combination of love and hatred.

controversial.definition: Causing many people to have strong arguments or disagreements.
controversial.example: Abortion is a highly controversial matter. Many people have strong feelings about it.

demanded.definition: To ask for something in a strong way because you think you must have it.
demanded.example: The opposition parties have demanded that all the facts be made public.

democracy.definition: A way to run a country where the people choose their leaders by voting.
democracy.example: There is a need for more democracy in that country. The citizens still don't have enough rights.

assure.definition: To tell someone that something is true so they do not worry.
assure.example: I assure you that you'll be able to make progress as long as you make an effort.

chaos.definition: A state of being very messy and having no order or control.
chaos.example: The failure of the electricity supplies created complete chaos in the city. Traffic was a mess.

confine.definition: To keep something inside a certain area or on a certain topic.
confine.example: Please confine your remarks to the subject under discussion. Don't talk about other things.

conception.definition: An idea or an understanding of what something is like.
conception.example: He's got a pretty strange conception of friendship. He treats his friends in a cold way.

combative.definition: Ready and wanting to fight or argue with people.
combative.example: He is famous as a(n) combative spokesman for human rights. He's ready and willing to fight.
